topic.title: Start Using the Python SDK
topic.shortdesc: The Couchbase Python SDK allows Python applications to access a Couchbase cluster. The Python SDK offers a traditional synchronous API as well as integration with twisted, gevent, and asyncio. It depends on the C SDK and utilizes it for performance and reliability.

body.p: Before installing the Python SDK, you must first install the C SDK.
body.section: Ensure you also have the Python development files and pip:sudo apt-get install python-dev python-pipsudo yum install python-devel python-pipThen, for all platforms:sudi pip install couchbase

The Python SDK is best tested with the Python available from homebrew, though it may also work on OS X's Python. For best results, install Python from homebrew:brew install pythonTo install the actual SDK, install it using pip:pip install couchbase
Installing on Microsoft WindowsDownload the executable installer relevant to your platform and Python version from .
Hello CouchbaseThe code snippet below shows how the Python SDK may be used for some common operations:
body.codeblock: >>> from couchbase.bucket import Bucket >>> cb = Bucket('couchbase://localhost/default') >>> cb.upsert('u:king_arthur', {'name': 'Arthur', ... 'email': 'kingarthur@couchbase.com', ... 'interests': ['Holy Grail', 'African Swallows']}) OperationResult<RC=0x0, Key=u'u:king_arthur', CAS=0xb1da029b0000> >>> cb.get('u:king_arthur').value {u'interests': [u'Holy Grail', u'African Swallows'], u'name': u'Arthur', u'email': u'kingarthur@couchbase.com'} >>> cb.n1ql_query('CREATE PRIMARY INDEX ON default').execute() >>> from couchbase.n1ql import N1QLQuery >>> row_iter = cb.n1ql_query(N1QLQuery('SELECT name FROM default WHERE ' +\ ... '$1 IN interests', 'African Swallows')) >>> for row in row_iter: print row ... {u'name': u'Arthur'}
body.section: API ReferenceThe API reference is generated for each release and can be found at http://pythonhosted.org/couchbase. Most of the API documentation can also be accessed via pydoc.

section.title: Contributing
section.p: Couchbase welcomes community contributions to the Python SDK. The Python SDK source code is available on GitHub.
